alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 1:55PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lincoln County through 245 PM MDT... At 155 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles west of Forder, or 44 miles northeast of Pueblo, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Lincoln County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for east central Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
